heading: # Chip groups
headingText: The `v-chip-group` supercharges the `v-chip` component by providing groupable functionality. It is used for creating groups of selections using chips.
usageText: Chip groups make it easy for users to select filtering options for more complex implementations. By default `v-chip-group` will overflow to the right but can be changed to a **column** only mode.

toothbrush.heading: ### Toothbrush card
toothbrush.desc: Chip groups allow the creation of custom interfaces that perform the same actions as an item group or radio controls, but are stylistically different.

filter-results.heading: ### Filter results
filter-results.desc: Easily create chip groups that provide additional feedback with the **filter** prop. This creates an alternative visual style that communicates to the user that the chip is selected.

blouse.heading: ### Blouse product card
blouse.desc: The `v-chip` component can have an explicit value used for its model. This gets passed to the `v-chip-group` component and is useful for when you don't want to use the chips index as their values.

column.heading: ### Column
column.desc: Chip groups with `column` prop can wrap their chips.

mandatory.heading: ### Mandatory
mandatory.desc: Chip groups with `mandatory` prop must always have a value selected.

multiple.heading: ### Multiple
multiple.desc: Chip groups with `multiple` prop can have many values selected.

props.appendIcon: The icon used in the append slot (if shown)
props.centerActive: Forces the selected chip to be centered
props.column: Remove horizontal pagination and wrap items as needed
props.nextIcon: Specify the icon to use for the next icon
props.prependIcon: This icon used in the prepend slot (if shown)
props.prevIcon: Specify the icon to use for the prev icon
props.showArrows: Force the display of the pagination arrows
